bibl.title: Davis v. Davis. Order to Show Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The First Judicial District Court

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF WASHINGTON TERRITORY AND FOR THE FIRST JUDICIAL DISTRICT THEREOF HOLDING TERMS AT COLFAX IN WHITMAN COUNTY IN SAID TERRITORY.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION " OF NELSON DAVIS FOR THE CUSTODY " ORDER TO SHOW WRIT AND OF MAGGIE M. DAVIS A MINOR CHILD. " ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE. "

Upon readingand filing the Petition of Nelson Davis, duly signed and verified by him, whereby it appears that Maggie M. Davis a minor child of the age of eleven years is wrongfully and without cause detained from the custody of Petitioenr, by Sarah M. Davis of Whitman County, Washington Territory, and that the said Sarah M. Davis, refuses to deliver said child to the custody of Petitioner, or to allow Petitioner ot exercise any control over her whatever, though Petitioner is willing and desirous to have the custody of said child and to maintain and care for it, and from which Petition it appears that a Writ of Habeas Corpus, ought to issue, it is ordered that a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the Seal of the District Court of the First Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Colfax, in Whitman County, directed to the said Sarah M. Davis, commanding her to have the body of the said Maggie M. Davis, the minor child aforesaid, before me, in open Court, at Colfax, in the County of Whitman, on the 14 day of December, 1888, at the hour of ten o'clock in the forenoon, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the custody of the said Maggie M. Davis together with the cause of her detention of the said minor child as afroesaid;

Done at my Chambers at Walla Walla, in Walla Walla County, in Washington Territory, This 3d day of Dec 1888
Wm G. Langford Judge
